website_summaries.verdict: Uses only a few different ingredients, so it's safer for dogs that have allergy problems.
pros: Does not contain grains or chicken, which is helpful for dogs that have problems with common food allergies
Only uses one source of protein
Has multiple important nutrients and vitamins that the dog needs to have a good overall level of health
cons: Uses some non-traditional sources of protein, which some dogs won't like

customer_reviews.title: Causes Heart Failure in Dogs!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t purchase the kangaroo flavor!!! There are lentils in this and the combination of kangaroo and lentils can cause heart failure in dogs!!!! I found out the hard way☹️ My baby is in heart failure and the cardiologist showed me research on the combination 😢😢
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NUMBER TWO ON FDA'S LIST OF DANGEROUS DOG FOODS!
customer_reviews.text: I asked if this food was Chinese when it first came out and got a ton of flack from the distributor. I had ordered a bag and nowhere on the bag did it say, "Made in the USA". I threw it out. Now, it turns out that this food accounts for the second most occurrences of congestive heart failure in dogs. I'm so glad I was vigilant. We consumers must all be vigilant about our dog's foods! Turns out grains weren't so bad - potatoes and peas and chickpeas may be worse!
customer_reviews.author: L. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Apoquel, goodbye itching
customer_reviews.text: After 3 years of horrible itching solved only by Apoquel meds, I am extremely happy to say that my dog is off the Apoquel as well as all other required supplements and ailments just to prevent itching so much (coconut oil, probiotics, etc). He just gets Zignature Whitefish dog food twice a day and he itches MAYBE 2 minutes in a 12 hour period. That's beyond incredible. Worth every cent. The only downside which I don't care about is that he has bigger stools now. The extra clean up is worth it to have such a happy, comfy dog! (Bluetick Coonhound/German Pointer cross).
customer_reviews.author: Terry-Anne

customer_reviews.title: Can cause heart disease
customer_reviews.text: This food almost killed my dog. He went into heart failure from low taurine induced dilated cardiomyopathy. The FDA has released several statements warning against many of the ingredients in zignature (and other foods) as a link to heart issues in dogs. Please check with your vets before feeding this. Edit- my sweet boy was part of study. His DNA was tested and it showed no genetic link to heart issues. Do not use this food!
customer_reviews.author: Moho

customer_reviews.title: Z is a great product BUT, You lost us at Greed!! $
customer_reviews.text: The dog has loved it for the past year. His color is excellent and his coat is shiny, However; We MUST DISCONTINUE using this product. It was already expensive. The price of a 27lb bag went from $45 to $65 in one month. It's unfortunate that many dogs will have to switch to less healthy foods, and Zigniture (with a great product) will LOSE MANY CUSTOMERS due to GREED. - If the price is reduced, we may purchase it again, but the whole 'Bait n Switch' is a huge turn off.
customer_reviews.author: michael sharp

customer_reviews.title: Good food for dogs who have yeast issues.
customer_reviews.text: My dog has yeast issues and I have to rotate his dog food every 9 months or so. The vet suggested the rotation and it really makes a difference. This one is especially good because it has no grains and is low in starch. Most people look for dog food without grains, but the food still has too much starch (potatoes, rice, tapioca). The starch helps promote yeast in their systems. I would recommend this one. We are on our second bag and will have to rotate to another type of food in a few months, but this is a great dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Kim in Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Veterinarian told me not to use Zignature
customer_reviews.text: A veterinarian told me that a recent FDA study showed that grain free diets can be fatal to your Dog. The Vet said "Zignature is one of the worst " of the grain free diets. CBS News also did a story on this. Dog owners, please talk to your Veterinarian to get their opinion about Zignature dog food and grain free diets. Amazon, if you delete this important review information I will write an Op Ed piece for the N.Y. Times discussing Amazon censoring important health information for a man's and woman's best friend. Dog lovers, please discuss grain free diets with your veterinarian and do some research at the CBS News site. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Caused heart failure in my golden retriever!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old golden retriever has been healthy forever minus some allergies. Switched to this to hopefully get rid of allergies. 4 months later she’s at the vet with Dilated cardiomyopathy and at risk of total heart failure. As many others have said, there are lots of FDA warnings about this. DO NOT FEED!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful limited ingredient food
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful limited ingredient food! My dog went bonkers for this food. I've never seen him beg for kibble (treats? yes, and often. not kibble) but he practically threw a fit to get more. My only issue with this food is the price (ouch!). I feel so good about the ingredients, as he has such sensitive skin and tummy. He has had zero skin issues and it is highly digestible. I love it, my dog loves it... Highly, highly recommend! P.S. I am willing sit up and beg too if the price would lower!
customer_reviews.author: A. Cales

customer_reviews.title: Dog absolutely loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My dog is picky and has what I thought was seasonal allergies. Turned out to be food allergies. He can't eat chicken, potatoes, starch, lamb, or beef. Makes him so itchy and bites his paws too. But after eating this dog food for a while now the constant scratching has lessened so much. He still eats his paws but not as much. So happy I found this food that he enjoys and makes him alot less itchy. He is a cheweene.
customer_reviews.author: B cuda

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my dogs food allergies under control.
customer_reviews.text: One of my dogs has horrible allergies. After trying all types of combinations of dog foods I finally sent in a sample of his saliva to Dr Jean Dodd in California and the results showed that he is allergic to just about everything except for the contents in this dog food. When I asked her what kind of dog food could she recommend this is one of two that she recommended. I was making his dog food from scratch and that was very time consuming and expensive. To make things easier for me I now feed my other three dogs this food and they're all doing very well.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle McNeill

customer_reviews.title: Yummy! Picky Bichon loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Mom likes the price, Mr. Picky eater Oliver loves the tiny size kibble and the ingredients have kept his fur silky, fluffy soft, no hot spots! The groomer commented on his healthy coat.! So many salmon dog foods add sweet potato that Oliver got a yeast infection from all the starchy SUGAR in potatoes. No potatoes in this food-Trout and salmon adds Salmon Oil and my dog's favorite veggie/fruits- blueberries, carrots, cranberries. And totally MADE IN USA. I couldnt find this brand in pet stores and with such a reasonable price, I'm happy too!
customer_reviews.author: Linda LeeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Dog Food !
customer_reviews.text: This food is amazing..my dog suffered from yeast problems and itchy skin..at the advice of a friend and dog owner..we switched to this food ..on our 2nd bag now.. yeast problems completely gone..no itchy skin..eyes have cleared up..and her fur is gorgeous..She is an Olde English BullDog and they are know for GI upsets..with this food there is almost none..All in all completely happy with this food. and my lulu loves it !!
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Zignature is worth every penny... Our little guy is a 8 year old Dachshund Beagle Mix is a happy camper now. For months we were having problems with ear infections, itching, hair loss and anal glands issues (yuck). After several visits to the vet and no long term improvement, he was still miserable. A friend recommended this brand due to the limited ingredients and in less that a week he was like a new dog. We havent had to go back to the vet for any of these issues and he is back to his happy self. It is expensive but we are so happy with the results and will be staying with this brand long term.
customer_reviews.author: Bluebird

customer_reviews.title: Stopped my dogs allergies
customer_reviews.text: Switching my dog to this food brand has stopped my dogs iching, fixed her stomach issues and bowl movements, gave her more energy, beautiful fur, and she even produces less phlegm around her eyes. She also had allergies that caused rashes and her skin to red, turns out she had food allergies from other dog foods that use grain and potatoes. This food has bettered my dogs quality of life and I can’t speak highly enough of this zinature food. I have been feeding her this food for about 6 months now.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great food, but its not really two day shipping!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog has allergies and most limited ingredient dog foods uses fish oil, which he can't have. Our dog loves the taste and no itchies or upset tummies. I don't really care for Amazon's Choice of seller. Everytime I order for TWO DAY shipping, my arrival time is 4 or 5 days from the date I order... So just forget two day shipping here, order a week ahead of time.
customer_reviews.author: Ray and Amy

customer_reviews.title: Best dog food, worth it?
customer_reviews.text: I've had dogs for 50 years, the last food I used was Taste of the Wild. It was okay, but at the bottom of the plastic tub was a heavy amount of crumbs caked and oily. This Kangaroo food has ZERO crumbs and not oily at all. The kibble is dark in color (looks like a Milkdud). The dog cleans his dish every night. It's a bit pricey but my Malinois is allergic to many protein sources and this product no more expensive than a vet prescribed food so I'm not complaining too loud.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Groniger

customer_reviews.title: Muffins approves this blend!
customer_reviews.text: The best dog food for a dog with food allergies. This limited ingredient blend is perfect for my little Pomeranian (Muffins). She has food allergies that cause itchy skin and digestive issues. Before switching to this food she had tummy problems and itchy/greasy fur from a yeast infection. She’s been eating this brand and blend for over a year and the difference is amazing! She is super active (we did an 8 mile backpacking trip) , she has a healthy appetite, and her skin and fur are healthy. Seriously, if your dog has food allergies and you’re looking for a limited ingredient blend, this is it! Buy it and your fur baby will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny S.

customer_reviews.title: BAD DOG FOOD
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been ordering this dog food for a long time, from a company or ordering from Amazon, this particular bagI ordered from amazon is almost at the expiration date, my dog was throwing up for two days couldn’t figure out why??? and he never regurgitates his food so I looked at the bag at the expiration date, VERY DISAPPOINTED THAT THIS WAS SHIPPED TO ME
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works for my Bully
customer_reviews.text: I have a 7 month old American Bully with terrible allergies. After trying several other grain-free, poultry-free varieties, this was recommended to me by several people with dogs that have allergies as well. It is a little expensive, but so is any other high end dog food. This worked for my dog and he is happy to eat it. I feel better that I am giving him high quality food and not a bunch of pills to mask his allergies.
customer_reviews.author: lissaj81

customer_reviews.title: So glad we found this for our dog
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in the lamb first...here is the review I posted for the lamb, but it applies here as well: This is the first dog food that our dog has actually eaten without 10 minutes of coaxing, literally kibble by kibble. Even canned food was snubbed. We always thought that we didn't have a real dog! Who ever heard of a dog that won't even eat salami?? Anyway...she eats this food, actually wants more, and we have no more food issues. Additionally, her licking and chewing has slowed down considerably. Previously she would lick and lick all night long. No longer. Expensive dog food...but so worth it. We now have a real dog.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Good for paw licking.
customer_reviews.text: Our dog was licking her paws a lot. A friend suggested Acana, which was just way too expensive. She said something about the duck meat and the simple ingredients helping with the paw licking. We are a month into feeding our dog this food and she almost never licks. We probably need to switch out treats and I bet she would stop licking completely. I highly suggest this food for paw licking.
customer_reviews.author: Lalla

customer_reviews.title: I'll never feed my English Bulldogs anything else
customer_reviews.text: I have two English Bulldogs, both have food limitations and allergies. The Kangaroo Formula from Zignature is the only food that I've found that works for both of them. It may be a little more expensive but it's worth it! No more excessive shedding, teary eyes or constant licking. This food has been wonderful for them.
customer_reviews.author: KLee

customer_reviews.title: Limited Ingredient Dog Food MAY Help Dogs with Food Allergies
customer_reviews.text: So far, this is the best food I've found for one of our dogs, a white lab who suffers with food and environmental allergies. This keeps her healthy and happy & seems to reduce allergic reactions better than anything else I've tried (and I've tried MANY premium brands). Price here at Amazon is very competitive & it's so handy to have this delivered right to the door, as needed. Highly recommended! --- Have a question about this dog food? Just leave a Comment & I'll be happy to help you, if I can.
customer_reviews.author: OK

customer_reviews.title: and they said he would do best on Kangaroo
customer_reviews.text: Our 6 lb. pom loves it. He is given to allergies. He went to the University of Georgia pet clinic for evaluation a couple years ago, and they said he would do best on Kangaroo. Ordered then from a private lab at very high prices. Recently a few months ago, switched him to this and things are going great. I will be ordering again soon.
customer_reviews.author: SCWoman

customer_reviews.title: BEST FOOD FOR A GREAT PRICE. switched from Orijen to this!
customer_reviews.text: I'll never feed my dog another brand of food ever again. Been feeding this food since it came out a couple years ago and my dog is very healthy and loves it. Grain free, potato free and gluten free! Single source proteins (except the zessential) I was actually a rep for a distribution company (Zeus) a couple years ago because I loved this food so much and wanted others to love it too! I WISH THEY WOULD MAKE CAT FOOD ALREADY!!!!!!! also, it's made in the USA! doesn't get much more perfect than that!
customer_reviews.author: Imogene

customer_reviews.title: if your dog is allergic to most all proteins in most dog foods  go pork
customer_reviews.text: my dog was tested for allergies and he has a limited diet and if your dog is allergic like mine to most all proteins in most wet or dry dog foods . than, pork meat as protein in a restricted limited diet is just the thing as it has stopped the constant scratching and hair loss on my dog. the cost of the test for allergies for your pet is hundreds of dollars and if you want to try pork as less costly than the test, then I would do it. All three of my min-pins love this food. so as a regular food that too is ok. hope that this has helped you
customer_reviews.author: Henry T

customer_reviews.title: Good Alternative to the Venison
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a cheaper alternative to Venison. Same formula, just a different protein. Been giving it to my dog a few months and no issues to report (highly sensitive and allergic to many ingredients and proteins). Update: Well I have gone back to venison due to the goat formula causing breath issues... and when I say "breath issues," I'm talking serious stink-breath. Having switched back to venison, the problem has disappeared. Not sure what was going on. Maybe she just has trouble digesting goat protein, but if it's sitting in her stomach long enough to cause that kind of problem, it can't be good for her.
customer_reviews.author: Stumpus

customer_reviews.title: The quality of this bag was different from prior orders.
customer_reviews.text: This was my third bag of the food - and this one looked and smelled a little different. And then my dog started having her old allergy issues again, so this will be the last bag. While I am a very active Amazon shopper, I will be buying my food from Chewy going forward because of this experience. For the price, I expect consistency. We buy our wet food from Chewy and will now be buying dry food from them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great For Allergy Prone Bully
customer_reviews.text: My Olde English Bulldogge is prone to food allergies that affect his skin, and my husband and I were desperate to find a natural, limited ingredient kibble for him before biting the financial bullet of going completely raw. He's a big dog and the expense of an all raw diet is daunting, to say the least. Zignature isn't the cheapest, but it is one of the best dry kibbles out there for dogs with food and skin allergies that we have tried. I recommend the Whitefish formula or the Salmon formula for skin issues..., it really made a difference!
customer_reviews.author: Mariam Mahler

customer_reviews.title: Great brand for my vizsla!
customer_reviews.text: I tried this dog food brand based off a recommendation from a vizlsa site saying it would help reduce inflammation/ear infections. My Vizsla ALWAYS got ear infections (almost every month) so I thought I would give it a try. After a a month of using this food, my dog's ear reactions significantly went down and her figure is much better as well. We were feeding her Taste of the Wild before, but ever since the switch to Signature, haven't gone back. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kkeenan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, but wish it had probiotics!
customer_reviews.text: I'm holding my breath, but so far so good. I have a highly allergic 5 yr old Shih Tzu who is so allergic to EVERYTHING (fleas, grass, pollen, chicken, corn, potatoes, additives, preservatives, etc.) He had to get used to the taste but is "grazing" nicely now. After 1/2 a bag, his stomach, and paws are definitely less red. I'm hoping this will be what he needs stop taking Apoquel and Zyrtec (yes, he is that bad,) and to be able to be a semi-normal little dog that gets to go outside more than 15 min a day! I'll update after the next bag! Adding probiotics would be nice!
customer_reviews.author: Janet L. Ohanis

customer_reviews.title: ... have five rescues and adhere to giving them the best that I can afford
customer_reviews.text: I have five rescues and adhere to giving them the best that I can afford. They eat a raw diet from Raw Dog Hawaii in the morning but at nights, especially after a long day, they are a wee bit hungry, so I supplement this dry food in a bowl so they can eat if they are hungry. Mind you, I have absolutely no complaints from them other than the food bowl was empty and I was given the stink eye. Raw is great, but is so super expensive and you can't leave it out to eat at whim, so Zignature Venison to the rescue. They are happy and very content dogs. All five of them.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Nakama

customer_reviews.title: We like it but...
customer_reviews.text: I really laughed when the review asked my opinion on value for money. Personally if I didn’t have to buy this I wouldn’t, it’s expensive and half the time my dog waste it. She can only have venison or kangaroo, she won’t eat venison which leaves kangaroo. I would like to see the ingredient of peas removed, not to be replaced by sweet potatoes either. It has a direct link to cardiac failure in dogs. Please take that out.
customer_reviews.author: ObergruppenführerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Ingredients caused allergies
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been feeding this to my puppy for 4 months. When I rescued him, he didn’t have itchy skin. He’s been itching the whole time I’ve had him. I switched to a raw diet and his itching stopped. It was definitely this food that made him miserable and he never wanted to eat until he got extremely hungry. I just thought he had a weird eating schedule of late night snacking like me.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Best Dry Dog Food Kibble
customer_reviews.text: We have tried literally a dozen or more high-end dog kibbles for our picky Alaskan Malamute girl, who still eats primarily raw food and expensive treats (like the Icelandic dried lamb horn bone marrow - yes, that's a real thing - and Icelandic's little whole dried fish). This is the ONLY dog food that Princess-Dog will eat, and she does so every day - albeit only to supplement her raw diet of uncooked beef or chicken and cooked sweet potatoes, spinach, yogurt, egg, bone meal and blueberries. (She eats better than we do and this is the only dog food she will put her snout in.) That's got to tell you something.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Customerica

customer_reviews.title: My dog’s coat is amazing
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but this time I had to. We started feeding our dogs this food four months ago. Recently we noticed our beagle’s coat has changed remarkably. Like a typical hound, her coat would often get oily and have a distinct smell a week or two after a bath. Now her fur is fluffy and soft all the time and stays like that long after a bath. There is never a smell or oily feeling anymore. We have changed nothing except her food. Premium food costs more but has proven to be totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this food! My dogs LOVE i!
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best food I've found for my dogs. One has allergies and this seems to drastically help him in that area. You pay a bit more for the food but you don't have to feed them as much so it evens out. I've got 2 dogs. 1 is 105lbs and the other 78lbs. A 27lb bag lasts me abt month and a half. They love the food and seem to really like the flavor. When I open a new bag they are waiting in line to put their heads in the bag. I've tried alot of foods but this one seems to keep them healthy and extremely happy!
customer_reviews.author: When life gives you lemons, make lemonade!

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Our pup was having extreme digestive issues that were hard to diagnose. We switched to this brand, and because it is one of the only dog foods on the market with NO FISH ingredients we were extremely excited that she started having healthy elimination. We have tried 3 different proteins from this company, and have been happy with all of them. If your dog is sensitive to fish - look at the fact that most omega 3 is from fish sources. A huge THANK YOU to Zignature for addressing this and being our solution.
customer_reviews.author: Barb K.

customer_reviews.title: No chicken, or egg, helped with my dog with her allergy.
customer_reviews.text: Happy to find dog food with no chicken or eggs, my has hair growing around the top of her nose again, I saw results before we were 1/2 way through the bag. So glad a friend recommended it.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome dog food
customer_reviews.text: Awesome dog food. My english bulldog was on Blue Buffalo before. He had chronic irritation between his paw digits. They itched and always bothered him. He also had problems with his ears. He has been on Zignature for about a month ALL his conditions are completely gone :)
customer_reviews.author: Jill Hackworth

customer_reviews.title: I love that the ingredients are limited
customer_reviews.text: After trying every dog food out there someone suggested Zignature and my pup LOVES it! She would not eat any of the other foods I tried and took to this right away. She had been dealing with upset stomach and GI issues on all the other foods we had tried. I love that the ingredients are limited, good quality ingredients that I can trust and we have had ZERO GI issues which is huge for a pup that my vet wanted me to go see a specilaist. This food has made all the difference, she is back to being and energetic puppy, her coat is shiny and she is gaining weight again.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: SO GLAD I TRIED THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I have two dogs. A Jack Russel and a mixed Jack Russel and Chihuahua. My pure breed Jack Russell doesn’t like anything. She is very finicky! I love my dogs so I am always trying to feed them healthy nutritious food. When I read ingredients I knew I had to try this. SO GLAD I DID! I usually have to mix a little peanut in her food because I add egg for her coat but not this. They both love it! I will NEVER feed my dog anything else. Now I have to find a good treat other than food off my plate. Lol
customer_reviews.author: R Y

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 7-day portion for adult 85lb dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this food. Highly recommended by his service dog training school (and they’re obsessed with treating these dogs like princes and princesses) as the ingredients are great and provides a balanced nutrition for my dog. Got this particular sized bag (4 lb) which was PERFECT portion for our 7-day vacation to Hawaii. Had it sent to my brother’s house ahead of time so we wouldn’t have to travel with dog food. Worked out like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Jaymie-Lyn Denison

customer_reviews.title: And used it as treats and my little Chihuahuas loved it. I decided to order a bag to ...
customer_reviews.text: Last year at a privately own pet supply store I received samples . And used it as treats and my little Chihuahuas loved it . I decided to order a bag to use as their regular meal. A little bit more expensive then some of the other brands . I know my dogs are getting the proper nourishment when They eat Zignature!
customer_reviews.author: G J

customer_reviews.title: The food was close to expiration
customer_reviews.text: I use this food for my allergic dog. Chewy was out of it, so I went to Amazon. I bough two bags which both had an expiration date two months in the future. Usually, the food is made a year before it's expiration date. That tells me that these bags were rather old.The food did not smell fresh either, which was no surprise. I kept them and are using them just because I'm afraid of a shortage during the pandemic. Usually, I would have returned the bags. Overall, the food was good, but older and almost at it's expiration date,
customer_reviews.author: J. Nittoli

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: We've been feeding our German Shorthaired Pointer the Zignature Turkey dog food since we weaned her off of puppy food. It seems to be very agreeable with her stomach and she's always excited to eat it. German Shorthaireds are notorious for a high-energy lifestyle and this food definitely fuels her and helps with her concentration and her coat is silky soft. Though it is not the cheapest dog food on the market, it is a very high quality with minimal fillers that I feel good about feeding to my dog. A+ for Zignature! Also have tried the duck formula, but that is a little bit richer and caused some issues with digestion.
customer_reviews.author: A.luebsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: great quality product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent dog food! Our dog has loved this for years; unfortunately, she can no longer tolerate the higher levels of protein, as she is now a senior, and has been diagnosed with Chronic Kidney Disease, and must now exist on a prescription diet of lower protein, mostly canned dog food. However, Zignature is probably one of the best, highest-quality foods available on the market today. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ChazW

customer_reviews.title: Sorry it didn't work for my dog :(
customer_reviews.text: Loved the quality! Really wanted it to work. Did the gradual switch from my pups other dog food, but even two weeks in, stool were still too soft. So, didn't work for me. I should say, however, that this is one of the only dog foods I found that uses clean machines to produce, unlike others, which is why you can't count on other dog food's quality, like you can with Zignature. I do recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Great taste and a quality food
customer_reviews.text: My dog has chronic ear infections and an overproduction of yeast. As a floppy eared dog the vet suggested perhaps trying a limited ingredient formula to tackle her infections via treatment and preventative care. So far she likes the food and as a medium sized 28lb dog with a little mouth she has no trouble eating it.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Great product for big dogs
customer_reviews.text: Dog seems to do well on this food. I have tried several types of dog food and either my rottweiler has a loose stool or he throws up. With this second bag of food I have noticed a improvement in his stool and digestion. I mix the dry food with his pedigree chunks and feed twice a day he is quite happy at this moment. I will continue to order as long as it still works and has fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna

customer_reviews.title: if your dog is allergic to most all proteins in most dog foods  go kangaroo
customer_reviews.text: my dog was tested for allergies and he has a limited diet and if your dog is allergic like mine to most all proteins in most wet or dry dog foods . than, kangaroo meat as protein in a restricted limited diet is just the thing as it has stopped the constant scratching and hair loss on my dog. the cost of the test for allergies for your pet is hundreds of dollars and if you want to try kangaroo as less costly than the test, then I would do it. All three of my min-pins love this food. so as a regular food that too is ok. hope that this has helped you
customer_reviews.author: Henry T

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: We've had our dog on this for almost two years now and no complaints! My only thought is to try another flavor and switch it up for our pup. Our dog is about 50lbs and we feed her twice a day about 1 and 1/4 scoops. We started her on this food after 6 months and she's almost two now and gets glowing reviews at her check ups!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is such good quality dog food. And my dog loves it! High in omega 3's, the quality of the kibble is really one of the best I've seen in a while. I only wish they had more variety of sizes online and it was a little less expensive. I could buy the size I wanted at a lower price at an independent pet supply retailer near my old house. When I moved a few months ago, there was no longer a reseller near me. So I came to Amazon to find it. Which I did but I would love more size options at better discounts.
customer_reviews.author: akw101

customer_reviews.title: Excellent food, I just have to purchase through an authorized seller.
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand and so does my dog. He has severe food allergies and the Zignature line is the only brand he doesn't have a reaction to. It's truly a quality food. Plus the proteins are interchangeable without a transition period. I turned to Amazon like most for my shopping needs because I live in rural Oregon. i unfortunately figured out that Amazon isn't an authorized seller for this food, so I'm buying it through another online retailer, which makes me sad. That said, this is without a doubt a quality food line and it holds true to the quality. It's also AAFCO approved and a true limited ingredient diet.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Best dog food
customer_reviews.text: Best dog food! Took us 2 years to find a food that our yorkie could eat. Without this food she has EXPLOSIVE diarrhea.... no fun at all. She can actually eat all the different flavors they offer with no issues to her GI system. Highly recommend this to ANYONE and EVERYONE! Also, big thanks to AMAZON for selling this food. We moved from Atlanta, GA (where I could find the food all over the place) to a tiny town in Alabama (where no one for miles around sells it). THANK YOU!!
customer_reviews.author: Lmccaul

customer_reviews.title: This has been one of the best dog foods that I have ever bought for my ...
customer_reviews.text: This has been one of the best dog foods that I have ever bought for my eleven year old dog. She has actually lost weight and enjoys eating it. I highly recommend this dog food based on my experience with it. We are currently on our second 27 lb bag.
customer_reviews.author: Nevermore778

customer_reviews.title: Great brand of dog food.
customer_reviews.text: Great dog food. Good for dogs with allergies. Higher cost is worth paying. Higher quality means they eat less. Rec. this brand and all it's flavors. Part of my dogs newly growing rotational diet .
customer_reviews.author: CntryGrlM

customer_reviews.title: Good for some breeds, but not mine.
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure this food is great for some dog, it’s wasnt good for mine. Within a week his skin got extremely dry and he was itchy. I have a Chinese Shar-Pei. They have a lot of allergies and I’m sure it’s just one of the ingredients but now I’m stuck with a big back of expensive dog food my dog can’t eat.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Zignature is a brand that stays in my rotation because I like the limited ingredients (easy for her stomach to break ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog has colitis and has to be fed a rotating protein diet and can not have processed chicken. Zignature is a brand that stays in my rotation because I like the limited ingredients (easy for her stomach to break down). Both my dogs love this food and I like how it is potatoe free as well as grain free to help keep their sugar levels low to help avoid other problems. This is not the only food I feed my dog (she always has 4 brands in rotation, one brand per feeding) but I can notice a difference when this food is not part of the monthly rotation. She has more energy and her coat is glossier with Zignature.
customer_reviews.author: Kas

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff for my good pup
customer_reviews.text: This is the only food my dog can eat because she's allergic to EVERYTHING. It's an investment, but she's been eating this for years and she's incredibly healthy. I attribute her good health to this diet. She's 10 but plays like she's 6. I'll keep getting this food because it works for her and it hasn't come under fire like other dog food brands have recently.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Works great for dogs with food allergies
customer_reviews.text: I started buying Zignature after using Fromm, Blue Buffalo and Orijen to help my cocker spaniel's food allergies. It's manifested itself in the form of seborrhea and the vet thinks it's food-related. This limited ingredient food seems to be helping her skin and all 3 of my dogs love it. We've recently switched to the whitefish formula after I read that trout can be an instigator for food allergies. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Jen C.

customer_reviews.title: Great brand of food for my pups.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love it enough to eat it. I love it because its the one brand that my dogs don't seem to be allergic to. I'm still on the road to finding something they will get excited about eating. I'm sure they're tired of eating Turkey all the time. It would be nice if they'd come down on the price for the Kangaroo.....just saying.
customer_reviews.author: ER

customer_reviews.title: Mya likes and so do the cats!
customer_reviews.text: I have a picky little chubby dog and I’m trying desperately to help her lose weight while also trying to put a stop to her chronic ear infections. We treat her ears but our vet also suggested a limited ingredient diet to help out with that. Little Mya seems to like the food and both the cats snack on it from time to time as well so it must be good!
customer_reviews.author: Marisa Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: I tried to return the item because it arrived with a slit in the bag. The policy said the item was not eligible for return. A piece of tape had been placed over the slit. There’s no quality assurance for contamination or freshness. I’m very disappointed and would like a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: This food works great for my 9 month old golden retriever
customer_reviews.text: This food works great for my 9 month old golden retriever! He was having diarrhea issue with his last brand but zignature is great! Love the ingredients
customer_reviews.author: Kimmi

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for my Suzie - severe allergies - no more medications
customer_reviews.text: This food has been a God-send for our Viszla. I never knew her lips were brown because she is so allergic. We have had her on Atopica (very expensive) from the vet due to her severe allergies. She has been on several grain free formulas with no improvement. However, one day while at the holistic dog food store - the owner informed me that a lot of dogs are allergic to chicken and chicken products. A lot of grain free foods have chicken and chicken fat added. Within 2 weeks she was remarkable better. Her coat is beautiful in color and shine. I am just so sorry it took me this long to find this product.
customer_reviews.author: dpauley

customer_reviews.title: Canine anti-inflammatory!
customer_reviews.text: We have an older dog that needs a more anti-inflammatory diet. This is the best food we have found for him other than what we make ourselves. His arthritis is much better and it helps to know we are not feeding him food that causes inflammation but in fact cools his inflammation down.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaBell

customer_reviews.title: No Chicken!
customer_reviews.text: My toy poodle is allergic to chicken and has bad knees after 4 knee surgeries. The duck is said to help the joints. To be sure there are other brands of duck but this is the only one I have found that doesn’t contain chicken disguised as duck. I like it for her, she likes it for her, and if you own a toy poodle you know it’s all about her.
customer_reviews.author: Vat

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs with allergies
customer_reviews.text: This food is so easy on my dogs tummy. She's very sensitive and allergic to a lot of stuff so after trying countless varieties, I think we finally found a keeper in Zignature kangaroo limited ingredient. We tried raw, limited ingredient, prescription dog food from the vet...I even made homemade dog food and nothing worked. She had gas or diarrhea or vomiting or all three. Now she loves her food, has a lot of energy and no digestion issues. We all love this dog food in our house!
customer_reviews.author: sakimoto

customer_reviews.title: Switch now, you and your dog will love it
customer_reviews.text: Got this at the recommendation of a friend and I'm so glad I did ! Its the only food my dogs digestive system seems to tolerate. No more gooey poop! She seems happier and her coat looks amazing. I attribute that to the great quality of the food and no chicken meal. She tried the lamb nutro and still had issues. So for the extra $15 a bag I think its totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves this food
customer_reviews.text: This is the first dog food that our dog has actually eaten without 10 minutes of coaxing, literally kibble by kibble. Even canned food was snubbed. We always thought that we didn't have a real dog! Who ever heard of a dog that won't even eat salami?? Anyway...she eats this food, actually wants more, and we have no more food issues. Additionally, her licking and chewing has slowed down considerably. Previously she would lick and lick all night long. No longer. Expensive dog food...but so worth it. We now have a real dog.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price!
customer_reviews.text: One of our lab mixes is easily the most finicky dog claiming us as his humans. He got bored with Purina One. Then we tried Blue. Got bored with that. The Zignature Whitefish formula has been the best bet for him so far. Yes, there was some sticker shock. But they are sweet creatures, and only here for such a relatively short time. I think they deserve it. If you think about it, you could blow this much on a single human meal. So...go for it. Try the small bag first to be sure it's going to be a good fit. That's what we did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs with food allergies
customer_reviews.text: My dog is allergic to poultry and it’s EXTREMELY hard to find dog food/ treats that don’t contain poultry fat/ by products/ flavor or eggs in them. EVEN if the product CLAIMS to be beef etc. great ingredients, lots of protein & my widdle long haired chihuahua, the infamous picky eater, LOVES it! How picky u say? Well, let’s just say she LOVES fries But she won’t so much as lick it twice if it’s cold lol ETA: Delivers QUICK !
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: 9 yr old toy breed died after going to this food.
customer_reviews.text: Our 9 yr old toy breed died of cardiac arrest after going to this food over the last two years. I have completely changed how I view limited ingredient foods. Have switched brands that is not grain free but gluten free.
customer_reviews.author: Powered by C

customer_reviews.title: Zignature Turkey Dry Dog Food = Happy Itch-Free Super Soft Coated Dog
customer_reviews.text: My English Bull Terrier has skin allergies AND is a really picky eater when it comes to dog food. Her coat and skin are the best they've ever been and, just as important, she loves the Zignature Turkey dry dog food. In the three years since I adopted her - this is a first. Soooooo glad I finally found this stuff!!
customer_reviews.author: audio slave

customer_reviews.title: Bags are not air tight like at local store
customer_reviews.text: My dog loved this food but the last two bags I have received have had holes in them. The bags at my local store are vacuum sealed tight. Makes me a bit nervous.
customer_reviews.author: Will T.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: We switched our pup to this food recently because it was better quality and she was bored of the old food. She LOVES it. She eats it like treats which is awesome. To know she's happy and healthy is worth the price difference.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer Bre

customer_reviews.title: Confused? Aggravating my dog’s allergies
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing Zignature Duck Formula for my pit mix with allergies for the last year or so. Usually order through Chewy but quarantine has shipping time delays. This food arrived in a color I’ve never seen before— I heard this may be due to different machinery used to make it? After about a week or two my dog is starting to scratch himself more often— his telltale sign of allergy. Confused why this is happening
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this by far is my gangs favorite. I have 3 boxers and a standard poodle
customer_reviews.text: After trying almost all brands of 4 & 5 star dog food as per dog food advisor, this by far is my gangs favorite. I have 3 boxers and a standard poodle. Also have a litter of boxer babies right now. This is the first dog food that they have eaten that they seem to really enjoy. It is a very high quality food. The coats of the boxers is very shiny, and all of them look to be in the best health ever. One of the boxers seems to be allergic to chicken, which is the main ingredient in most dog foods, this does not contain chicken and works well...no more itching or ear infections.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Persons

customer_reviews.title: poultry-free diet due to allergies and they LOVE this food
customer_reviews.text: My pups are on a limited ingredient, grain-free, poultry-free diet due to allergies and they LOVE this food. I often rotate between this and another formula due to me forgetting to order this on time, and as soon as it comes and I feed my two pitties and beagle, they go nuts. Actually, Mason guards the bag and I have to put up high as he will growl at the others if they come near. I would like to note that since we have been using this formula, the amount of foot licking has decreased to almost none from wet spots on the bed and sofa.
customer_reviews.author: Pantone300

customer_reviews.title: Check Expiration date
customer_reviews.text: Love Zignature, running a rescue I stock up when it is on sale. Received 2 bags that where within 3 months of expiring, not happy about that
customer_reviews.author: Mingo

customer_reviews.title: Good dog food but a bit pricey.
customer_reviews.text: We fed our dog this food for over a year. She really loved it and seemed to make her happy. The dog food was pretty expensive though so we recently switched to another brand. The transition was easy for her. It wasn't because of the quality of the food but the price.
customer_reviews.author: teach326

customer_reviews.title: Avoid, caused horrible diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: I had this brand before from a different supplier. My dog loved it and did not get any allergic reations. This time, with this batch, he had nearly immediate diarrhea that go worse and worse. He had blood and a lot of mucous in his wattery stool. He had to go out nearly every 15 min during the night and I thought this was the end of it. Switched food immediately to a different brand and within 2 days he was back to nor.al.
customer_reviews.author: Ulrich Stingl

customer_reviews.title: Best Dog Food
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would be that guy that buys premium dog food...but my dog was itching all of the time and I wanted to try something. Within a week of eating Zignature Trout and Salmon, her itching is gone. She has now been on it for 9 months and never been healthier.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: SEEMS like a quality Kibble
customer_reviews.text: So far My dog loves this food, it even has a pleasent kind of fruity scent when I open the bag. My dog likes it & I havent seen any recalls so I would recommend this. While its not enough nutrition for them by itself,I also feed half can of wet food too & use the Zignature as more "crunchy" for him as I feel it also helps clean their teeth somewhat.
customer_reviews.author: justjess

customer_reviews.title: Research Zignature and heart disease in dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure how many are familiar with the new scare of heart disease by using some grain free foods . Zignature was listed as a dog food to steer away from. I just ordered a 40 lb bag. I hear they have a new food and have changed some ingredients. I wish they would they would take mine back so I can try the new recipe.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Try a sample and your dog will love it!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is diabetic and this is what I feed him. He really loves it. I decided to spend a little more on higher quality dog food and am glad I did. He likes this food, and we have tried a variety of the flavors. He likes them all but didn’t seem that thrilled about the kangaroo. I tried to tell him how cool it was he could have kangaroo but he still didn’t like it as much as the others. My local feed store offered a free sample for us to get started with this.
customer_reviews.author: Molly G

customer_reviews.title: More expensive than buying locally
customer_reviews.text: Zignature overall is great food. My boy loves it and it's one of the few that doesn't give him super stinky dog farts. I've ordere the 27lb bag a couple times now, when I know I won't be able to drive the half hour to the feed supply store. The price has gone up a few dollars over the last year. It used to be $4 more than getting it locally, it's crept up to $10 more. Still great if I don't have a chance to run to the feed store.
customer_reviews.author: Myla Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Itchy
customer_reviews.text: I’m happy with the Zignature line, and alternate within the brand to keep my doggo allergy-free, but this one’s made him itch terribly bad. He’s not interested in eating it. I’m not saying this won’t be perfect for your pet, each has their own types of dietary issues, it just didn’t work out for mine.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Great for Dogs w sensitive stomach
customer_reviews.text: My dog and her stomach love this. Seems like it tastes good to her. Plus, I have tried different flavours and she likes all. I try to buy a different flavour each week to give her variety. There has not been any side effects.
customer_reviews.author: Meh

customer_reviews.title: A quality, limited ingredient dog food...
customer_reviews.text: Zignature is a high quality kibble at an amazingly low price. I found this product through a friend who works for a high end pet supply store... and with all of her knowledge base regarding the many, many options of foods to feed her own dogs...this is what she chooses. We can spend all kind of money for great dog food, however this is great one without spending a lot. This is a limited ingredient food, no grain, no artificial additives and uses peas as the binding carb source vs. corn or grain. I mix this food with an equal amount of raw diet and I have one happy, healthy dog!
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Rat Terrier approved
customer_reviews.text: My dog won’t eat anything else. He’s a 15 lb. Rat Terrier and this was reccomended by our local natural pet store. The ingredients are great and he loves it! Wrigley has allergies and this seems to help him compared to all the other brands we have tried. They even have wet food to add if you want but when we gave the wet food with dry we noticed him get a bit chubby. So we are just sticking with dry food but we love this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Better the the prescription KO by Royal Canine
customer_reviews.text: After years of GI issues, we put our dog on prescription Kangaroo dry dog food. Royal Canine bought the former maker out and the ingredients changed slightly enough to cause some GI issues to return and for my dog not to like it. I tried several other proteins and toppers and then found this. My dog was hesitant at first so I included the canned wet food which he loved. Now he eats a little of both the dry and wet throughout the day and is thriving and enjoys his meals. This has been a lifesaver for a very finicky and sensitive stomach dog.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn P Anastassopoulos

customer_reviews.title: Zignature Kangaroo formula food cured my Lhasa Apso of her awful skin condition
customer_reviews.text: My vet sold me a kangaroo food which made my dog vomit every time she ate it. I tried Zignature, my dog loved it, it didn't make her sick and her skin condition cleared up. As for the price, it is right in line with every other Kangaroo food for dogs. Since my dog is small a bag lasts quite awhile. I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Swansrest

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Brand of Dog food
customer_reviews.text: Amazing brand of food!!! I would have to say though my babies like the white fish better, nothing wrong just liked thenother flavor better. I have been trying different flavors of Zignature food and my babies have enjoyed all of them. They just like some flavors over others, and I have picky spoiled rotten babies that will not eat something if they don’t like it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Best poops ever!
customer_reviews.text: Worth the extra $10-$20. Doggo has allergies to poultry and sometimes the beef isn't always great (first poop is firm but lots of mucous, second poop is messy). My doggo is small-o but always has to poop two times on her walk! With this kibble, both poops come out nice and firm. Buy this to make your poop picking experience more tolerable. :)
customer_reviews.author: P0

customer_reviews.title: My dogs don’t like it.
customer_reviews.text: We have two Shih Tzus and a Chi mix that are all picky eaters. We’ve been feeding this for over a month and our girls just don’t eat it well even after taking weeks to transition them over. I selected this brand and flavor because of the quality of the product and and supposedly the kangaroo would entice them to eat better. I’ll be going back to the Lamb. My dogs are not a fan.
customer_reviews.author: psl

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves the stuff. He is 11 yrs ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves the stuff. He is 11 yrs old and seems to handle this food (digestion) very well.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Z

customer_reviews.title: Made both my dogs sick
customer_reviews.text: Both of my dogs vomited and and diarrhea for the week the were on this. I even mixed it with their previous food. I just think it just didn't sit well in their tummies
customer_reviews.author: SoCal mommyx4

product_meta.title: Zignature Limited Ingredient Formula Grain-Free Dry Dog Food
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Kangaroo| Size:12.5lbAs an exotic protein, Kangaroo is the healthiest pet food, rich with twice the Vitamin B12 of other meats.
